title: Bear forced to 'salute' and crocodile manhandled in degrading animal circus act
text:
News Bear forced to 'salute' and crocodile manhandled in degrading animal circus act Bizarre spectacles involving seals, dogs, monkeys and birds will also be watched by audiences at the Ukrainian National Circus in Kiev Share A crocodile and its tamer perform during the presentation of the new show at the National Circus in Kiev, Ukraine (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A 'saluting' bear in a hat and a seal 'playing the guitar' are just some of the animals forced to perform a degrading circus act . 
A crocodile manhandled held aloft by a human performer and a monkey flown through the air in a miniature pirate shop are also among the bizarre spectacles watched by audiences at the Ukrainian National Circus. 
Brown bears , pink pelicans, macaws, peacocks, dogs also feature in 'Water and Fire' production in Kiev. 
They will be forced to perform twice a week for the next three months. A bear salutes alongside its tamer (Photo: REUTERS) A seal performs during the show (Photo: REUTERS) 
Pictures of the circus's opening night show a seal on a stool pretending the play the guitar and a bear wearing a hat doing a military-style salute alongside a man. 
Animal rights groups condemn the use of wild creatures in circus acts, but it is not illegal in most countries. 
Previous shows at the Kiev circus have involved a performer sticking his head in a crocodiles mouth. Read More The bear is forced to wear a hat and perform (Photo: REUTERS) A monkey is raised in a pirate ship (Photo: REUTERS) 
The Ukraine government said last year it was considering banning the use of animals in circuses. 
The ministry for environment and natural resources said it supported the idea of action to protect creatures from cruel treatment 
The World Animal Protection organisation ranks countries on treatment of animals and currently rates Ukraine an E, the third worst grade. Read More Dogs perform during the show (Photo: REUTERS) 
In May last year, the 146-year-old US circus retired its elephant act following legal action by activists. 
The Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey admitted no wrongdoing but agreed to a six-figure fine several years before ending the elephant performances. A pelican performs in Kiev (Photo: REUTERS) 
In the UK, the RSPCA has campaigned for animal circus acts to be banned. 
Its says: "We don't believe animals should be subjected to the conditions of circus life. 
"Regular transport, cramped and bare temporary housing, forced training and performance, loud noises and crowds of people are often unavoidable realities for the animals." Like us on Facebook
